name: Cabra Castle Hotel

reviews.title: Fantastic but "out of the way"
reviews.text: The grounds and setting are both breath-taking!...Unfortunately, if you do no have a car (like I did), you are "stuck" there. But what a place to be "stuck". NOTE to persons who have difficulty getting around: to experience to total atmosphere, ambiance and ancestry of this property you need to walk around in it--UP the stairs, DOWN the stairs, DUCK your head for the smaller doorway, WATCH out for the stony path and uneven surfaces outside.
The room was plushly antiquated, with the large canopy bed, and the double doors led to a courtyard with statues. However, again, to get to it was a walk through the main castle then to
reviews.title: Awesome stay

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: the outside because my room was in the "stables".
reviews.title: Cabra Castle - WOW

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I had lunch in the bar area, and took my food outside. Watch your step UP into the courtyard area! My waitress was friendly and helpful..although the food took longer than I expected to arrive.
reviews.title: A Night in a Real Castle!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Dinner was elegant in the upstairs dining room. Save room for dessert..it is so easy to overeat for the main course because the food is wonderful. That night the dessert was a "miss" not a "hit", but my waiter arranged for compensation in the form of an extra drink of my choice.
reviews.title: Nice place to get away

reviews.text: We have stayed there four times and would go back tomorrow. It is such a wonderful experience. When you arrive you are greeted by "Oscar" the irish wolfhound. He is big and cuttely, he always stayes in front of the fireplace in the entrance hall. All the staff is friendly and most helpful The rooms are big and furnished with beautiful antik's. In the dining room you are set back in time with the old family pictures and antik furneswhings.. The food is outststanding and the service
reviews.title: Experience a fairy tale of your own

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: is promt and friendly. A good place to visit the Magalitic gravesights in Newgrange and Dowth.
reviews.title: A good table and four poster bed makes for a happy stay

reviews.text: the magalitic sights of Dowth and
reviews.title: Great place for last night in Ireland

reviews.text: We arrived at Cabra Castle with all the right karma going down. I had just married off my forth and final daughter some days previously in a succession that saw all four of my daughters married in little over a year. More importantly it was our 40th wedding anniversary.
reviews.title: Like walking into a fairy tale

reviews.text: As I have said in so many reviews that one's attitude to a hotel is often influenced by what precedes arrival. A bad airport or taxi experience and often the hotel gets the backlash from the mood created. This hotel started with a bonus.
reviews.title: Lovely stay but not quite perfect.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I attended a wedding here recently and the food and service were excellent. The room where the function is held is lovely, very romantic and well lay out with the bar inside the room. Great wedding venue for sure.
reviews.title: Wedding food Excellent!

reviews.text: My friend and I treated ourselves to one night in Cabra Castle recently, hoping to just chill and take it easy and leave the world behind. I don't think we could have chosen a better place.
reviews.title: A Heavenly Haven

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: It is a beautiful castle in magnificent grounds, but with none of the stuffiness one might expect in such a venue. Staff were friendly and helpful, the ambiance was one of total relaxation. We were booked into one of the courtyard rooms, spacious and comfortable, with a fantastic attention to detail. Dinner was delicious, as was breakfast the next morning and, to be honest, we were so relaxed and comfortable that if we hadn't set an alarm, we would have overslept and missed breakfast! We left there wishing we could stay another night, but promising that we would go back at some point, and there can be no better testament to a really good hotel.
reviews.title: bonus points

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: If you bring your significant other here you will win big bonus points with them for sure! The rooms are spacious and very comfy. Dinner at the Castle was ROCKIN! Breakfast was also very good. If ya need WiFi they have it in the lobby and the bar area for free. The grounds wre beautiful. One last thing... Oscar the castle dog (an irish wolfhound) was so cool and friendly ya had to luv him!
reviews.title: Live like a king!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: My husband and I spent one night here and we were not disappointed. We booked a suite in the castle. The room was beyond amazing. The bathroom was bigger than my college apartment and a romantic curtain placed over the bathtub. The bedroom was decorated in the medival style and we felt like royalty sleeping in the bed. We explored the castle, and took a lovely walk through the woods. We dined at the restaurant inside the hotel and the food was great. I highly recommend staying here for couples. Make sure to book a room inside the castle.
reviews.title: Wonderful romantic getaway

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We stayed for 1 night with a bus tour and I would definitely like to go back some day. I do not have anything negative to say about our stay here except I would love to stay in the main part of the castle if I get to go back. Even though the room we had was beautiful. The grounds are beautiful, the food was excellent, the decor was impressive. The bar staff was friendly and did their job well. The room was well decorated, very clean, and relaxing. It felt very welcoming know mater where you were in the castle
reviews.title: Elaborate Wow

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I recently visited Ireland. It was lifelong dream. Upon arrival in Dublin at 5:15 in the morning, my wife and I rented a car and by 8'oclock set off for the Cabra Castle, not to check in, but to determine the location. Check in time was scheduled for 3PM. We found the castle hotel in only an hour's drive from the airport, and going in to verify our reservation, we were invited to check in early and "take a nap" to relieve the jet lag. We were impressed to say the least. The staff was incredibly accommodating and discovering it was my wife's birthday, upgraded (at no charge) to without a doubt, the most beautiful hotel room we've ever been in. From the lush appointments, to the free standing tub, it was a dream come true. The staff made us feel like visiting royalty. Dinner was spectacular and the bottom line is, if you want the experience of a lifetime, visit Cabra Caslte.
reviews.title: An enchanting getaway to treat your wife.
Great way to end our tour of Ireland
reviews.text: We were pleasantly surprised when we saw our room in the courtyard wing. It was large, modern and had a king size bed. The castle itself was very impressive and Oscar the Irish Wolfhound could be found roaming around everywhere. There is free WiFi in the lobby and bar area. The grounds are beautiful but some of the guest rooms are haunted.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: stayed as part of wedding recption beautiful big room for reception food glorious stayed in courtyard which was fine though difficult to navigate to wedding recption. guinness was poor on the day ageneral comment from most quests.
reviews.title: wedding

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We loved our stay at this castle-hotel. Even though there were several wedding parties, the grounds and facilities are large enough to accomodate everyone. Each morning the breakfast was outstanding and dinner at sunset was beautiful. Lots to do. Golf right there and complimentary. Exploring little towns in the area was fun during the day. This hotel was not a far drive after landing at Dublin and well worth the effort to see the Irish countryside.
reviews.title: Beautiful Courtyard Room

description: From the moment you arrive through the 100 acres of beautifully manicured gardens and parkland to the magnificent 19th century 4 Star Castle Hotel set deep in the Cavan countryside you will feel totally welcomed and thoroughly spoiled.
